quotes.text: They were all dead. The final gunshot was an exclamation mark to everything that had led to this point. I released my finger from the trigger. And then it was over.
The past is a gaping hole. You try to run from it, but the more you run, the deeper, more terrible it grows behind you, its edges yawning at your heels.
I don't know about angels, but it's fear that gives men wings.
The trouble with wanting something is the fear of losing it, or never getting it. The thought makes you weak.
A bit closer to heaven.
The genius of the hole: no matter how long you spend climbing out, you can still fall back down in an instant.
I had a hole in my second favorite drinking arm, and the only way out of the frozen storage was through the loading bay.
Nothing to do but wait. Watching the dead-end street of my life. My brain felt like a migraine waiting to happen.
I lied to myself that it was over. I was still alive, my loved ones were still dead. It wasn't over.
I was in a New York minute. In a New York minute, everything can change.
The way I see it there's two types of people: those who spend their lives trying to build a future and those who spend their lives trying to rebuild the past.
When you're walking in heaven, the bad things are easier to believe.
It was a classic mob hit. No worries. No fuss. Just another page in the obituaries.
A fugitive undercover cop framed for murder, following a trail of blood. These people were here for the reason I'd stayed alive. One way or another, this was going to end.
You'd find that Lady Luck was really a hooker, and you were fresh out of cash.
The things that I want not to be true are true, and the things that I want to be true are not true.
The storm seemed to lose its frenzy. The ragged clouds gave way to the stars above.
Collecting evidence had gotten old a few hundred bullets back. I was already so far beyond the point of no return I couldn't even remember what it had looked like when I had passed it.
There are no choices. Nothing but a straight line. The illusion comes afterwards, when you ask 'Why me?' and 'What if?'
I had a bullet. I had a gun. Time to go to work.
The sun went down with practiced bravado. Twilight crawled across the sky, laden with foreboding.
Vladimir Lem. Dearest of all my friends. If I had known, I wouldn't have hurt you.
